page.title: 03MERTON YESTERDAY
page.content:
{Merton}has been the site of continuous human habitation since at least the eleventh century and was described in the Domesday Book of 1086 as a manor belonging to the Bishop of Coutances.
In 1608 the most famous son of {Merton },{George Monk},later to become Duke of Albermarle, was born in the parish at Great Potheridge.
Ten of the surnames found in eighteenth century Indentures of Apprenticeship can still be found in {Merton}today.
Since the middle of the last century the population of{Merton}has steadily declined as follows:--- 1861_820,1891_463,1935_423,1981-300.
